item.title: addiction medicine
item.description: Extracellular Matrix Abnormalities in the Hippocampus of Subjects with Substance Use Disorder Authors: Valeri, J.; Stiplosek, C.; O'Donovan, S. M.; Sinclair, D.; Grant, K. A.; Bollavarapu, R.; Platt, D. M.; Stockmeier, C. A.; Gisabella, B.; Pantazopoulos, H. Score: 4.1, Published: 2023-09-08 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.07.23295222 Contextual triggers are significant factors contributing to relapse in substance use disorders (SUD). Emerging evidence points to a critical role of extracellular matrix (ECM) molecules as mediators of reward memories.

item.title: allergy and immunology
item.description: Observational Study of Repeat Immunoadsorption (RIA) in Post-COVID ME/CFS Patients with Elevated Beta-2-Adrenergic Receptor Autoantibodies Authors: Stein, E.; Heindrich, C.; Wittke, K.; Kedor, C.; Kim, L.; Freitag, H.; Krueger, A.; Toelle, M.; Scheibenbogen, C. Score: 406.1, Published: 2023-09-01 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.31.23294813 There is increasing evidence for an autoimmune aetiology in post-infectious Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (ME/CFS). SARS-CoV-2 has now become the main trigger for ME/CFS. We have already conducted two small proof-of-concept studies of IgG depletion by immunoadsorption (IA) in post-infectious ME/CFS, which showed efficacy in most patients.

item.title: animal behavior and cognition
item.description: African elephants address one another with individually specific calls Authors: Pardo, M. A.; Fristrup, K.; Lolchuragi, D. S.; Poole, J.; Granli, P.; Moss, C.; Douglas-Hamilton, I.; Wittemyer, G. Score: 131.8, Published: 2023-08-27 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.25.554872 Personal names are a universal feature of human language, yet few analogs exist in other species. While dolphins and parrots address conspecifics by imitating the calls of the addressee 1,2, human names are not imitations of the sounds typically made by the names owner 3.

item.title: biochemistry
item.description: Broad receptor tropism and immunogenicity of a clade 3 sarbecovirus Authors: Lee, J.; Zepeda, S.; Park, Y.-J.; Taylor, A. L.; Quispe, J.; Stewart, C.; Leaf, E. M.; Treichel, C.; Corti, D.; King, N. P.; Starr, T. N.; Veesler, D. Score: 102.9, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.557371 Although Rhinolophus bats harbor diverse clade 3 sarbecoviruses, the structural determinants of receptor tropism along with the antigenicity of their spike (S) glycoproteins remain uncharacterized.

item.title: bioengineering
item.description: Protein generation with evolutionary diffusion: sequence is all you need Authors: Alamdari, S.; Thakkar, N.; van den Berg, R.; Lu, A. X.; Fusi, N.; Amini, A. P.; Yang, K. K. Score: 172.6, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.11.556673 Deep generative models are increasingly powerful tools for the in silico design of novel proteins. Recently, a family of generative models called diffusion models has demonstrated the ability to generate biologically plausible proteins that are dissimilar to any actual proteins seen in nature, enabling unprecedented capability and control in de novo protein design.

item.title: bioinformatics
item.description: The tidyomics ecosystem: Enhancing omic data analyses Authors: Hutchison, W. J.; Keyes, T. J.; Crowell, H. L.; Soneson, C.; Mu, W.; Park, J.-E.; Davis, E. S.; Nahid, A. A.; Tang, M.; Yuan, V.; Axisa, P.-P.; Kitt, J. W.; Poon, C.-L.; Sato, N.; Gottardo, R.; Morgan, M.; Lee, S.; Lawrence, M.; Hicks, S. C.; Nolan, G. P.; Davis, K. L.; Papenfuss, A. T.; Love, M. I.; Mangiola, S. Score: 118.1, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.

item.title: biophysics
item.description: Inhibition of Parkinsons Disease-related LRRK2 by type-I and type-II kinase inhibitors: activity and structures Authors: Leschziner, A. E.; Sanz Murillo, M.; Suarez, A. V.; Dederer, V.; Chatterjee, D.; Louro, J. A.; Knapp, S.; Mathea, S. Score: 36.1, Published: 2023-09-09 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.07.556689 Mutations in Leucine Rich Repeat Kinase 2 (LRRK2) are a common cause of familial Parkinsons Disease (PD), and a risk factor for the sporadic form. Increased kinase activity has been shown in both familial and sporadic PD patients, making LRRK2 kinase inhibitors a major focus of drug development efforts in PD.

item.title: cancer biology
item.description: Mutually exclusive teams-like patterns of gene regulation characterize phenotypic heterogeneity along the noradrenergic-mesenchymal axis in neuroblastoma Authors: Sehgal, M.; Nayak, S. P.; Sahoo, S.; Somarelli, J.; Jolly, M. K. Score: 10.4, Published: 2023-09-05 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.03.556132 Neuroblastoma is the most frequent extracranial pediatric tumor and leads to 15% of all cancer-related deaths in children. Tumor relapse and therapy resistance in neuroblastoma are driven by phenotypic plasticity and heterogeneity between noradrenergic (NOR) and mesenchymal (MES) cell states.

item.title: cardiovascular medicine
item.description: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study Authors: Salih, A. M. A.; Boscolo Galazzo, I.; Menegaz, G.; Altmann, A. Score: 2.2, Published: 2023-09-14 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.13.23295516 Existing research demonstrates association of shorter telomere length (TL) with increased risk of agerelated health outcomes including cardiovascular diseases. However, the direct causality of these relationships is not definitively established. Cardiovascular aging at an organ-level may be captured using image derived phenotypes (IDPs) of cardiac anatomy and function.

item.title: cell biology
item.description: The anti-SARS-CoV-2 BNT162b2 vaccine suppresses mithramycin-induced erythroid differentiation and expression of embryo-fetal globin genes in human erythroleukemia K562 cells Authors: Zurlo, M.; Gasparello, J.; Verona, M.; Papi, C.; Cosenza, L. C.; Finotti, A.; Marzaro, G.; Gambari, R. Score: 973.5, Published: 2023-09-07 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.07.556634 The COVID-19 severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic. The SARS-CoV-2 Spike protein (S-protein) plays an important role in the early phase of SARS-CoV2 infection through efficient interaction with ACE2.

item.title: dermatology
item.description: Testing the Limits of Language Models: A Conversational Framework for Medical AI Assessment Authors: Johri, S.; Jeong, J.; Tran, B. A.; Schlessinger, D. I.; Wongvibulsin, S.; Cai, Z. R.; Daneshjou, R.; Rajpurkar, P. Score: 33.7, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.23295399 Large Language Models (LLMs) show promise for medical diagnosis, but traditional evaluations using static exam questions overlook the complexity of real-world clinical dialogues. We introduce a multi-agent conversational framework where doctor-AI and patient-AI agents interact to diagnose medical conditions, evaluated by a grader-AI agent and medical experts.

item.title: developmental biology
item.description: A Meta-Atlas of the Developing Human Cortex Identifies Modules Driving Cell Subtype Specification Authors: Nano, P. R.; Fazzari, E.; Azizad, D.; Nguyen, C. V.; Wang, S.; Kan, R. L.; Wick, B.; Haeussler, M.; Bhaduri, A. Score: 26.0, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.557406 Human brain development requires the generation of hundreds of diverse cell types, a process targeted by recent single-cell transcriptomic profiling efforts. Through a meta-analysis of seven of these published datasets, we have generated 225 meta-modules - gene co-expression networks that can describe mechanisms underlying cortical development.

item.title: ecology
item.description: Unveiling the ecology, taxonomy and metabolic capabilities of MBA03, a potential key player in anaerobic digestion Authors: Puchol-Royo, R.; Pascual, J.; Ortega-Legarreta, A.; Otto, P.; Tideman, J.; de Vries, S.-J.; Abendroth, C.; Tanner, K.; Porcar, M.; Latorre-Perez, A. Score: 89.1, Published: 2023-09-08 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.08.556800 Biogas, a mix of CO2, CH4 and small proportions of other gases, is a biofuel obtained by anaerobic digestion (AD). Biogas production is often considered a black box process, as the role and dynamics of some of the microorganisms involved remain undisclosed.

item.title: emergency medicine
item.description: Attacks on Ukrainian healthcare facilities during the first year of the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine Authors: Barten, D.; Tin, D.; Granholm, F.; Rusnak, D.; van Osch, F.; Ciottone, G. Score: 10.2, Published: 2023-08-29 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.29.23294763 BackgroundAlthough the Geneva Conventions and Rome Statute demand protections for healthcare facilities during war, breaches of these protections are frequently reported. The ongoing war in Ukraine is no exception, with several healthcare attacks eliciting widespread condemnation.

item.title: endocrinology
item.description: Morning exercise and pre-breakfast metformin interact to reduce glycaemia in people with Type 2 Diabetes: a randomized crossover trial Authors: Pena Carrillo, B. J.; Cope, E.; Gurel, S.; Traslosheros, A.; Kenny, A.; Mody, N.; Delibegovic, M.; Philip, S.; Thies, F.; Blana, D.; Gabriel, B. M. Score: 15.3, Published: 2023-09-07 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.07.23295059 Exercise is recommended in the treatment of Type 2 Diabetes and can improve insulin sensitivity [1]. However, previous evidence suggests that exercise at different times of the day in people with type 2 diabetes may have opposing outcomes on glycaemia [2].

item.title: epidemiology
item.description: Serological outcomes of SARS-CoV-2 infection by vaccination status and variant in England Authors: Quinot, C.; Lunt, R.; Kirsebom, F.; Andrews, N.; Whitaker, H.; Skarnes, C.; Letley, L.; Haskins, D.; Angel, C.; Firminger, S.; Ratcliffe, K.; Sheridan, A.; Rajan, S.; Akindele, L.; Ijaz, S.; Zambon, M.; Brown, K.; Ramsay, M.; Lopez Bernal, J. Score: 137.0, Published: 2023-09-06 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.05.23295073 BackgroundThroughout the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, several vaccines have been rolled out and distinct variants with different severity and immune profiles emerged in England.

item.title: evolutionary biology
item.description: Deep mutational scans of XBB.1.5 and BQ.1.1 reveal ongoing epistatic drift during SARS-CoV-2 evolution Authors: Taylor, A. L.; Starr, T. N. Score: 81.1, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.11.557279 Substitutions that fix between SARS-CoV-2 variants can transform the mutational landscape of future evolution via epistasis. For example, large epistatic shifts in mutational effects caused by N501Y underlied the original emergence of Omicron variants, but whether such large epistatic saltations continue to define ongoing SARS-CoV-2 evolution remains unclear.

item.title: gastroenterology
item.description: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS Authors: Hong, H.; Mocci, E.; Kamp, K.; Zhu, S.; Cain, K. C.; Burr, R. L.; Perry, J. A.; Heitkemper, M. M.; Weaver-Toedtman, K.; Dorsey, S. G. Score: 1.2, Published: 2023-09-14 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.14.23295434 Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), a disorder of gut-brain interaction, is often comorbid with somatic pain and psychological disorders. Dysregulated signaling of brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) and its receptor, tropomyosin-related kinase B (TrkB), has been implicated in somatic-psychological symptoms in individuals with IBS.

item.title: genetic and genomic medicine
item.description: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals dysregulated cellular programmes in the inflamed epithelium of Crohn's disease patients. Authors: Krzak, M.; Alegbe, T.; Taylor, D. L.; Ghouraba, M. H.; Strickland, M.; Satti, R.; Thompson, T.; Arestang, K.; Przybilla, M. J.; Ramirez-Navarro, L.; Harris, B. T.; Cheam, K. A. X.; Noell, G.; Leonard, S.; Petrova, V.; Jones-Bell, C.; James, K. R.; Wana, N.; Hu, M. X.; Skelton, J.; Ostermayer, J.; Gu, Y.; Dawson, C.

item.title: genetics
item.description: Expression Level Analysis of ACE2 Receptor Gene in African-American and Non-African-American COVID-19 Patients Authors: Nyamari, M. N.; Omar, K. M.; Fayehun, A. F.; Dachi, O.; Bwana, B. K.; Awe, O. I. Score: 19.5, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.11.557129 BackgroundThe COVID-19 pandemic caused by SARS-CoV-2 has spread rapidly across the continents. While the incidence of COVID-19 has been reported to be higher among African-American individuals, the rate of mortality has been lower compared to that of non-African-Americans.

item.title: genomics
item.description: Regulatory Transposable Elements in the Encyclopedia of DNA Elements Authors: Du, A. Y.; Chobirko, J. D.; Zhuo, X.; Feschotte, C.; Wang, T. Score: 54.4, Published: 2023-09-06 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.05.556380 Transposable elements (TEs) make up about half of the human genome and many have the biochemical hallmarks of tissue- or cell type-specific cis-regulatory elements. While some TEs have been rigorously documented to contribute directly to host gene regulation, we still have a very partial view of their regulatory landscape.

item.title: geriatric medicine
item.description: Proteomic aging clock predicts mortality and risk of common age-related diseases in diverse populations Authors: Argentieri, M. A.; Xiao, S.; Bennett, D.; Winchester, L.; Nevado-Holgado, A. J.; Albukhari, A.; Yao, P.; Mazidi, M.; Lv, J.; Li, L.; Adams, C. J.; Clarke, R.; Amin, N.; Chen, Z.; van Duijn, C. M. Score: 17.7, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.13.23295486 Circulating plasma proteins play key roles in human health and could be used to measure biological aging to predict risk of mortality, disease, and multimorbidity beyond chronological age.

item.title: health economics
item.description: A Literature Review and Meta-Analysis of the Effects of Lockdowns on COVID-19 Mortality - II Authors: Herby, J.; Jonung, L.; Hanke, S. Score: 225.6, Published: 2023-09-05 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.30.23294845 The purpose of this systematic review and meta-analysis is to determine the effect of lockdowns on COVID-19 mortality based on available empirical evidence. Lockdowns are defined as the imposition of at least one compulsory, non-pharmaceutical intervention (NPI). We employ a systematic search and screening procedure in which 19,646 studies are identified that could potentially address the purpose of our study.

item.title: health informatics
item.description: Randomized Controlled Trials Evaluating AI in Clinical Practice: A Scoping Evaluation Authors: Han, R.; Acosta, J. N.; Shakeri, Z.; Ioannidis, J.; Topol, E.; Rajpurkar, P. Score: 70.0, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.23295381 BackgroundArtificial intelligence (AI) has emerged as a promising tool in healthcare, with numerous studies indicating its potential to perform as well or better than clinicians. However, a considerable portion of these AI models have only been tested retrospectively, raising concerns about their true effectiveness and potential risks in real-world clinical settings.

item.title: health systems and quality improvement
item.description: Risk of Ischemic Stroke after COVID-19 Bivalent Booster Vaccination in an Integrated Health System Authors: Sharff, K.; Tandy, T. K.; Lewis, P. F.; Johnson, E. S. Score: 6.4, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.11.23295368 PurposeWhat is the absolute occurrence of ischemic stroke and transient ischemic attack after a COVID-19 bivalent vaccination? MethodsWe conducted a retrospective cohort study of Kaiser Permanente Northwest (KPNW) patients 18 years and older who were vaccinated with either the Pfizer or Moderna formulation of the COVID-19 bivalent vaccine between September 1, 2022 and March 1st 2023.

R. Score: 1.1, Published: 2023-09-14 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.14.23295571 Background: Large language model (LLM) based chatbots have recently received broad social uptake; demonstrating remarkable abilities in natural language understanding, natural language generation, dialogue, and logic/reasoning.

H. Score: 796.9, Published: 2023-09-05 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.04.556272 The continued evolution of SARS-CoV-2 may lead to evasion of vaccine immunity and natural immunity. A highly mutated Omicron variant BA.

item.title: molecular biology
item.description: DNA methylation shapes the Polycomb landscape during the exit from naïve pluripotency Authors: Albert, J. R.; Urli, T.; Monteagudo-Sanchez, A.; Le Breton, A.; Sultanova, A.; David, A.; Schulz, M.; Greenberg, M. V. C. Score: 53.8, Published: 2023-09-14 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.14.557729 In mammals, 5 methyl-cytosine (5mC) and Polycomb Repressive Complex 2 (PRC2)- deposited histone 3 lysine 27 trimethylation (H3K27me3) are generally mutually exclusive at CpG-rich regions. As mouse embryonic stem cells exit the naive pluripotent state, there is a massive gain of 5mC coincident with a restriction of broad H3K27me3 to 5mC-free, CpG-rich regions.

item.title: nephrology
item.description: The citrate transporter SLC13A5 as a therapeutic target for kidney disease: evidence from Mendelian randomization to inform drug development Authors: Gill, D.; Zagkos, L.; Gill, R.; Benzing, T.; Jordan, J.; Birkenfeld, A.; Burgess, S.; Zahn, G. Score: 2.2, Published: 2023-08-29 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.29.23294760 BackgroundSolute carrier family 13 member 5 (SLC13A5) is a Na -coupled citrate co-transporter that mediates the entry of extracellular citrate into the cytosol. SLC13A5 inhibition has been proposed as a therapeutic target for reducing progression of kidney disease via its effects on citrate metabolism.

item.title: neurology
item.description: Navigating the Neurological Aftermath of COVID-19: An In-Depth Exploration Authors: Butt, M.; Nagpal, S.; Phillips, E.; Shah, S. Q.; Dogar, Z.; Loh, H.; Mishra, S.; Vijayan, R.; Jeyakumar, R.; Makkar, S. S.; Jahan, S.; Diaz, G. M.; Franca, H.; Javed, S.; Belizaire, M.-P.; Reddy Somagutta, M. Score: 138.9, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.10.23295343 BackgroundThe COVID-19 pandemic caused by SARS-CoV-2 has affected millions of people and can result in both immediate and prolonged neurological effects, including severe complications.

item.title: neuroscience
item.description: SARS-CoV-2 Spike amyloid fibrils specifically and selectively accelerates amyloid fibril formation of human prion protein and the amyloid β peptide Authors: Larsson, J. N.; Hellstrand, E.; Hammarström, P.; Nyström, S. Score: 2152.6, Published: 2023-09-01 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.01.555834 An increasing number of reports suggest an association between COVID-19 infection and initiation or acceleration of neurodegenerative diseases (NDs) including Alzheimers disease (AD) and Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD). Both these diseases and several other NDs are caused by conversion of human proteins into a misfolded, aggregated amyloid fibril state.

item.title: oncology
item.description: Deep Learning Model for Tumor Type Prediction using Targeted Clinical Genomic Sequencing Data Authors: Darmofal, M.; Suman, S.; Atwal, G.; Chen, J.-F.; Chang, J. C.; Toomey, M.; Vakiani, E.; Varghese, A. M.; Balakrishnan Rema, A.; Syed, A.; Schultz, N.; Berger, M.; Morris, Q. Score: 16.1, Published: 2023-09-10 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.08.23295131 Tumor type guides clinical treatment decisions in cancer, but histology-based diagnosis remains challenging. Genomic alterations are highly diagnostic of tumor type, and tumor type classifiers trained on genomic features have been explored, but the most accurate methods are not clinically feasible, relying on features derived from whole genome sequencing (WGS), or predicting across limited cancer types.

item.title: ophthalmology
item.description: Performance of ChatGPT in Diagnosis of Corneal Eye Diseases Authors: Delsoz, M.; Madadi, Y.; M Munir, W.; Tamm, B.; Mehravaran, S.; Soleimani, M.; Djalilian, A.; Yousefi, S. Score: 2.1, Published: 2023-08-28 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.25.23294635 IntroductionAssessing the capabilities of ChatGPT-4.0 and ChatGPT-3.5 for diagnosing corneal eye diseases based on case reports and compare with human experts. MethodsWe randomly selected 20 cases of corneal diseases including corneal infections, dystrophies, degenerations, and injuries from a publicly accessible online database from the University of Iowa.

item.title: palliative medicine
item.description: A rapid systematic review of the effectiveness of out-of-hours palliative care telephone advice lines for people living at home and their carers Authors: Johansson, T.; Chambers, R.; Curtis, T. C.; Pask, S.; Greenley, S.; Brittain, M.; Bone, A. E.; Laidlaw, L.; Okamoto, I.; Barclay, S.; Higginson, I. J.; Murtagh, F. E. M.; Sleeman, K. E. Score: 1.2, Published: 2023-08-31 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.30.23294814 BackgroundPeople with palliative and end-of-life care needs in the community and their carers often rely on out-of-hours services to remain at home.

item.title: pathology
item.description: Digital holo-tomographic 3D maps of COVID-19 microclots in blood to assess disease severity Authors: Bergaglio, T.; Synhaivska, O.; Nirmalraj, P. Score: 5.7, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.557318 The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has impacted health globally. Cumulative evidence points to long-term effects of COVID-19 such as cardiovascular and cognitive disorders diagnosed in patients even after the recovery period. In particular, micrometer-sized blood clots and hyperactivated platelets have been identified as potential indicators of long COVID.

item.title: pediatrics
item.description: The neonatal gut microbiota: a role in the encephalopathy of prematurity Authors: Vaher, K.; Blesa Cabez, M.; Lusarreta Parga, P.; Binkowska, J.; van Beveren, G. J.; Odendaal, M.-L.; Sullivan, G. P.; Stoye, D. Q.; Corrigan, A.; Quigley, A. J.; Thrippleton, M. J.; Bastin, M. E.; Bogaert, D.; Boardman, J. P. Score: 5.8, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.23295409 Preterm birth is associated with atypical brain development and alterations in the gut microbiome.

item.title: pharmacology and therapeutics
item.description: Association between Haloperidol use and Risk of Rheumatoid Arthritis Authors: Ambati, V.; Cummings, T.; Yerramothu, P.; Nguyen, J.; Sutton, S. S.; Werner, B.; Magagnoli, J. Score: 9.2, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.11.23295367 Haloperidol is an anti-psychotic used for the treatment of schizophrenia or Tourette disorder. Here we report, by studying three large administrative health insurance databases, that haloperidol use is associated with a reduced risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis. A meta-analysis revealed a 31% reduced hazard of incident rheumatoid arthritis among individuals with schizophrenia or Tourette disorder treated with haloperidol compared to those treated with other anti-psychotic drugs.

item.title: pharmacology and toxicology
item.description: Machine Learning connects structure, bitterness & mechanism to antimalarial activity Authors: Sambu, S. Score: 1.5, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.08.556833 Machine learning allows us to identify patterns we might otherwise have missed in the data. It therefore provides an ample solution to the age-old problem of lossless research. When the pattern is robust and the signal is durable, it is possible to use relatively modest amounts of data to build powerful well-learned models.

A.; Van de Loock, A.; Lievens, E.; Marin-Arraiza, L.; Van Vossel, K.; Yigit, N.; Anckaert, J.; Weyns, A.; Van Thienen, R.; Sahl, R. E.; Zanoteli, E.; Lawlor, M. W.; Mestdagh, P.; Vandesompele, J.; Ochala, J.; Hostrup, M.; Derave, W.; Deshmukh, A. S. Score: 48.5, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.

item.title: plant biology
item.description: Cellular gibberellin dynamics govern indeterminate nodule development, morphologyand function Authors: Drapek, C.; Radzman-Mohd, N. A.; Rizza, A.; Schiessl, K.; Dos Santos Barbosa, F.; Wen, J.; Oldroyd, G. E. D.; Jones, A. M. Score: 34.0, Published: 2023-09-11 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.09.556959 During nutrient scarcity, plants can adapt their developmental strategy to maximize their chance of survival. Such plasticity in development is underpinned by hormonal regulation, which mediates the relationship between environmental cues and developmental outputs.

item.title: primary care research
item.description: The Sensation and Pain Rating Scale: easy to use, clear to interpret, and responsive to clinical change Authors: Madden, V. J.; Kamerman, P.; Leake, H. B.; Catley, M. J.; Heathcote, L. C.; Moseley, L. G. Score: 2.1, Published: 2023-09-09 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.08.23295128 The Sensation and Pain Rating Scale (SPARS) allows rating of non-painful as well as painful percepts. Although it performs well in the experimental context, its clinical utility has not been tested.

item.title: psychiatry and clinical psychology
item.description: Social media use and internalising symptoms in clinical and community adolescent samples: A systematic review and meta-analysis Authors: Fassi, L.; Thomas, K.; Parry, D. A.; Leyland-Craggs, A.; Ford, T.; Orben, A. Score: 16.1, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.23295355 ImportanceThere are many concerns about the link between social media use and adolescent mental health. However, most research has studied adolescents from the general population, overlooking clinical groups. To address this gap, we synthesize, quantify and compare evidence on the relationship between social media use and internalising symptoms in adolescent clinical and community samples.

item.description: Genomic epidemiology of the cholera outbreak in Malawi 2022-2023 Authors: Chabuka, L.; Choga, W. T.; Mavian, C. N.; Moir, M.; Tegally, H.; Wilkinson, E.; Naidoo, Y.; Inward, R.; Morgenstern, C.; Bhatt, S.; Wint, W. G. R.; Khan, K.; Bogoch, I. I.; Kraemer, M. U. G.; Baxter, C.; Tagliamonte, M.; Salemi, M.; Lessells, R.; Mitambo, C.; Chitatanga, R.; Bango, J. B.; Chiwaula, M.; Chavula, Y.; Bukhu, M.; Manda, H.; Chitenje, M.

item.title: radiology and imaging
item.description: Charting Aging Trajectories of Knee Cartilage Thickness for Early Osteoarthritis Risk Prediction: An MRI Study from the Osteoarthritis Initiative Cohort Authors: Li, T.; Luo, T.; Chen, B.; Huang, C.; Shen, Z.; Xu, Z.; Nissman, D.; Golightly, Y.; Nelson, A.; Niethammer, M.; Zhu, H. Score: 1.2, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.12.23295398 Knee osteoarthritis (OA), a prevalent joint disease in the U.S., poses challenges in terms of predicting of its early progression. Although high-resolution knee magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) facilitates more precise OA diagnosis, the heterogeneous and multifactorial aspects of OA pathology remain significant obstacles for prognosis.

item.title: rehabilitation medicine and physical therapy
item.description: HEART rate variability biofeedback breathing programme for LOng Covid dysautonomia (HEARTLOC): results of a feasibility study Authors: Corrado, J.; Iftekhar, N.; Halpin, S.; Li, M.; Tarrant, R.; Grimaldi, J.; Simms, A.; O'Connor, R. J.; Casson, A.; Sivan, M. Score: 4.0, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.09.23295208 IntroductionPost-covid-19 syndrome, or Long covid (LC) refers to symptoms persisting 12 weeks after Covid-19 infection. LC comprises a wide range of dysautonomia symptoms, including fatigue, breathlessness, palpitations, dizziness, pain and brain fog.

item.title: scientific communication and education
item.description: You do not receive enough recognition for your influential science Authors: Arabi, S.; Ni, C.; Hutchins, B. I. Score: 38.9, Published: 2023-09-08 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.07.556750 During career advancement and funding allocation decisions in biomedicine, reviewers have traditionally depended on journal-level measures of scientific influence like the impact factor. Prestigious journals are thought to pursue a reputation of exclusivity by rejecting large quantities of papers, many of which may be meritorious. It is possible that this process could create a system whereby some influential articles are prospectively identified and recognized by journal brands but most influential articles are overlooked.

item.title: sexual and reproductive health
item.description: Factors associated with teenage pregnancies during the Covid-19 period in Pakwach district, Northern Uganda: a case-control study Authors: Alunyo, J. P.; Mukunya, D.; Napyo, A.; Matovu, J. K.; Okia, D.; Wanume, B.; Okello, F.; Tuwa, A. H.; Wenani, D.; Okibure, A.; Omara, G.; Olupot Olupot, P. Score: 1.5, Published: 2023-09-14 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.13.23295521 Abstract Background: Teenage pregnancy rates have globally decreased over the years, but remain high, especially in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).

item.title: sports medicine
item.description: A Systematic Review on the Effects of Exercise on Gut Microbial Diversity, Taxonomic Composition, and Microbial Metabolites: Identifying Research Gaps and Future Directions Authors: Cullen, J.; Shahzad, S.; Dhillon, J. Score: 39.6, Published: 2023-09-08 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.05.23294991 The gut microbiome, hosting a diverse microbial community, plays a pivotal role in metabolism, immunity, and digestion. While the potential of exercise to influence this microbiome has been increasingly recognized, findings remain incongruous. This systematic review examined the effects of exercise on the gut microbiome of human and animal models.

item.title: synthetic biology
item.description: IMPROVING ANTIBODY AFFINITY USING LABORATORYDATA WITH LANGUAGE MODEL GUIDED DESIGN Authors: Krause, B.; Subramanian, S.; Yuan, T.; Yang, M.; Sato, A.; Naik, N. Score: 17.4, Published: 2023-09-13 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.13.557505 AO_SCPLOWBSTRACTC_SCPLOWProtein design requires searching exponentially large spaces of possible sequences to find candidates with desired properties. Language models (LMs) pretrained on universal protein datasets have shown potential to help make this search space tractable. However, LMs trained on natural sequences alone have limitations in designing proteins with novel functions, which is especially important for many pharmaceutical applications.

item.title: systems biology
item.description: Escalating High-dimensional Imaging using Combinatorial Channel Multiplexing and Deep Learning Authors: Ben-Uri, R.; Ben Shabat, L.; Bar-Tal, O.; Bussi, Y.; Maimon, N.; Keidar Haran, T.; Milo, I.; Elhanani, O.; Rochwarger, A.; Schürch, C. M.; Bagon, S.; Keren, L. Score: 22.2, Published: 2023-09-12 DOI: 10.1101/2023.09.09.556962 Understanding tissue structure and function requires tools that quantify the expression of multiple proteins at single-cell resolution while preserving spatial information. Current imaging technologies use a separate channel for each individual protein, inherently limiting their throughput and scalability.

item.title: zoology
item.description: "Dark taxonomy": a new protocol for overcoming the taxonomic impediments for dark taxa and broadening the taxon base for biodiversity assessment Authors: Meier, R.; Srivathsan, A.; Oliveira, S. S.; Balbi, M. I. P. A.; Ang, Y.; Yeo, D.; Amorim, D. d. S. Score: 30.2, Published: 2023-09-15 DOI: 10.1101/2023.08.31.555664 We are entering the 6th mass extinction event on the planet with scarcely any data for "dark taxa" that comprise most animal species.
